import React, { useState } from 'react'; import Close from '../../assets/images/close.svg'; import QueryPerson from '../../assets/images/person.svg'; import {DndContext, useDroppable } from '@dnd-kit/core'; import {Droppable} from './Droppable'; import {Draggable} from './Draggable'; function Play() { const [isDropped, setIsDropped] = useState(false); const { isOver, setNodeRef } = useDroppable({ id: 'droppable', }); // const draggableMarkup = ( // Drag me // ); function handleDragEnd(event) { if (event.over && event.over.id === 'droppable') { setIsDropped(true); } } const buttons = [ 'Select', 'from', 'AND', 'OR', '*', 'customers', ]; return (

Select All

Imagine you have a friend's contact list. To see all their contacts, you'd say, "Hey, can you show me ALL the information in your 'contacts' list?" In SQL, to get all data from a table named "customers," you'd use the SELECT * symbol.

Display all data from a table named "customers" {/* {isDropped ? draggableMarkup : ''} {!isDropped ? draggableMarkup : null} Select from AND OR * customers */} {/* droppable area */} {buttons.map((buttonLabel, index) => ( {buttonLabel} ))}

); } export default Play;
